channel.title: PC not giving visual when booting up
channel.description: Finally got my parts in and built my computer. Upon my first start up all the fans worked, my motherboard was lit up so I know it is receiving power, my psu is going, but I am getting "no connection" blue screen when I plug my hdmi cable from my TV to both my motherboard and my Videocard's ports. I seriously have no fucking clue why it isn't working. Plus help.

item.title: PC not giving visual when booting up
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Post pictures when you get done, and maybe install the Valley benchmark and Firestrike so you can gauge performance and post those too! I just installed a few new fans in my PC, and I realized how OCD I am about touching the chassis to prevent ESD…It’s real. Don’t let the magic smoke out of the motherboard ;).

Read full topic
item.source: PC not giving visual when booting up

item.title: PC not giving visual when booting up
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:7, topic:548822”]Okay got all that shit fixed lol, idk wtf was going on but my shitty 1999 monitor gives a picture.

New question, should I install 8.1 on my SSD? And by that I mean when I boot up 8.1 the first time ever, put in the key code, and choose where the files will be played, I choose my SSD right?[/quote]
Yes. You install the OS to the SSD. That, along with installed programs, are all that should be on the SSD.
The rest should go on your other drive.

Read full topic
item.source: PC not giving visual when booting up

item.title: PC not giving visual when booting up
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

yes, re-set the video card in the motherboard. also most modern gpus don’t bother turning on their fans till it is actually needed.

Read full topic
item.source: PC not giving visual when booting up

item.title: PC not giving visual when booting up
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:4, topic:548822”][quote author=t4 link=topic=667727.msg4465604#msg4465604 date=1419914862]
is your video card set in correctly?
[/quote]dis.
make sure it’s plugged in and doesn’t wiggle lots

[quote author=Elrick link=topic=667727.msg4465607#msg4465607 date=1419915493]
That is another issue I just found. I have it installed correctly with the PCI-E cables plugged in but the fans are not working.
[/quote]fans for the graphics card? make sure your using enough power. some require more than your power supply gives (in terms of the wires available)[/quote]
I have both 6 pin slots connected. The card itself clicked into the slot.

EDIT: When I booted up the comp again I watched the fans spin, so it is receiving power. You think I may need to remove and reinstall the videocard?

Read full topic
